In my logs, only the .dslogs and .dsevents are available, but I want to add the .wpilogs. How can I add this log?

By adding in a logging framework such as DogLog or WPILib’s built in logger Epilogue

DogLog is extremely simple to add into your code base, and the extensive documentation walks you through everything.

AdvantageKit is another option, but a very complex one

So, I just need to install DogLog and use this command DogLog.log("Arm/Position", motor.getPosition().getValue()); for the logs I want to access?

thats how you log a field, if you want to view your log files either click Download WPILogs in your DS or Install a flash drive formatted in FAT32 to your RIO

Just to be clear adding AdvantageKit not complex at all.
You can do everything you need with just
Logger.RecordOutput(“MotorPosition”, Motor.getPosition())

etc

I would certainly take a look at the built in DataLogManager. DogLog is an option, but DataLogManager is already built in and fully supported.

It’s super easy to get started, just add one line to the constructor of Robot and all of your NetworkTable data will be logged automatically.

DataLogManager.start();

You can also log specific data, but I find it ideal to send most values over NT so I can also view them in realtime with AdvantageScope or a dashboard.

You can add joystick and driverstation data to the log with one more line of code:

DriverStation.startDataLog(DataLogManager.getLog());

Epilogue is also built into WPILib this year, and it offers some more advanced options for automatic logging, and it also will automatically send that data over NetworkTables.

Don’t overlook vendor signal logging as well. CTRE’s SignalLogger will automatically turn on during matches with the FMS, and you can turn it on manually for in your shop as well.

There’s also the Unofficial REV-Compatible Logger (URCL) for REV signal logging.

In short, these loggers will automatically log all signals from the relevant devices, so it can be super useful to figure out what was going on after a match.
